LanguageData.LPR_MessageCornerMarkerAmount: There are now {0} corner markers on this map.
LanguageData.LPR_MessageCornerMarkerTooLess: Rendering needs 2 markers to limit the rendered area. Now the full map will be rendered.
LanguageData.LPR_MessageCornerMarkerTooMany: Rendering will create and use a virtual rect around all markers. You may want to remove unnecessary ones.
LanguageData.LPR_MessageCornerMarkerCorrect: Rendering will limit to the enclosed area.
LanguageData.LPR_MessageCornerMarkesRectHeightTooLow: Height is too low. This will result in incorrect renderings. More than 20 cells height are recommended.
LanguageData.DesignatorCornerMarkerDesc: Place corner markers for map rendering. Placing 2 will limit the rendering to only render the enclosed area.
LanguageData.DesignatorCornerMarkerRemoveDesc: Remove corner markers for map rendering. Removing all will let the rendering render the full map.
LanguageData.LPR_SettingsEnabledDescription: When enabled, this mod takes automatic renderings of current maps while playing and uses the settings below. You can temporary disable this here so you don't have to remove the mod each time.
LanguageData.LPR_SettingsRenderSettingsDescription: Configure some optional graphical elements that should be included in the rendered images. The map will always be rendered while some temporary parts like your current selection, targeters or ui text and the mouse cursor are never included.
LanguageData.LPR_SettingsRenderDesignationsDescriptio: Enable this when the rendered images should show designators. For example the mining, smoothing and plant cut designators.
LanguageData.LPR_SettingsRenderThingIconsDescription: Enable this when the rendered images should show overlay icons on things and buildings. For example "forbidden", "no fuel", "no power" and such icons.
LanguageData.LPR_SettingsRenderGameConditionsDescript: Enable this when the rendered images should contain game condition effects (like weather and lighting from toxic fallout).
LanguageData.LPR_SettingsRenderWeatherDescription: Enable this when the rendered images should contain the current ingame weather.
LanguageData.LPR_SettingsSmoothRenderAreaStepsLabel: Smooth render area on change (set smoothing steps)
LanguageData.LPR_SettingsSmoothRenderAreaStepsDescrip: You can increase this if you want a smoother transition of your rendered area when you change the area with corner markers. Rendering will transition smoothly to the new area in the next X renderings. (Note that it may take a while to geet to the new area if you choose a high step value and a low render interval.)
LanguageData.LPR_SettingsIntervalDescription: Choose the render interval, so how often a progress image should be taken. You can choose a frequency between once a quadrum and hourly.
LanguageData.LPR_SettingsTimeOfDayDescription: Choose at which time (in hours) of the selected days the rendering should happen. If you chose an interval of multiple times per day above, this setting works as an offset.
LanguageData.LPR_JPGQualityDescription: Higher values correspond to higher image quality, lower values correspond to smaller image size
LanguageData.LPR_SettingsPixelPerCellDescription: Define with how many pixels each ingame map cell should be displayed on the rendered image.
LanguageData.LPR_SettingsScaleOutputImageDescription: Set this if you want the rendered output image to have a fixed height. The width will be calculated to preserve the aspect ratio. Useful when you change the rendered area size mid-game and and plan to animate the image sequence later, so you can work with one fixed image size.
LanguageData.LPR_SettingsExportPathDescription: The path where rendered images will be saved. Note that this must be a valid path to an existing and accessible directory on your computer. You can copy+paste a directory from your file explorer here for simple editing.
LanguageData.LPR_SettingsCreateSubdirsDescription: Enable this if you want rendered images to be stored in subdirectories for each game/world by the world seed.
